content: Hi Jason, How are you doing today?

I... I don’t know. Like the house I’m building last summer. Foundation’s cracked, and I just keep patching the same spot. (Pauses, fingers digging into his jeans) Sleep’s been worse lately. Wake up at 5, drenched in sweat, and... (shrugs, voice dropping) Might as well be a broken machine. Doesn’t matter how many times I try to fix it. (Avoids eye contact, focuses on a thread on his sleeve) You’d think after six months I’d get used to it, but... (long pause) The cracks just get bigger.
6 months is a long time to experience this. Is this your first time seeking help?

I... I haven’t talked to anyone about it before. (Fidgets with a loose thread on his sleeve, avoiding eye contact) My dad always said therapy was for people who couldn’t fix their own problems. (Voice drops) I guess I thought if I just... worked harder, built something solid enough, it’d go away. But the cracks... they’re everywhere now.
What do you mean by cracks? Can you give me some examples?

Like... the job site last month. (Tugs at his sleeve, knuckles whitening) I messed up the beam calculations. Whole crew had to redo the framing. My foreman said it was 'careless,' but I knew it was worse. I let everyone down. (Voice cracks, then hardens) And Maria... we used to hike every weekend. Now I cancel. She asks why I’m always tired, but it’s not that. It’s like I’m... (pauses, staring at his hands) I’m a cracked foundation. Even if we patch it, the house won’t hold. (Mumbles) She’d be better off without me anyway.

There’s... the debt. (Fingers dig into jeans, voice barely audible) I’ve been borrowing against my paychecks. Maria doesn’t know. I told her it was ‘tools’ or ‘rent.’ But the numbers don’t add up. I’m digging a hole, and every paycheck just... (shrugs) Makes the walls closer. (Stares at hands, knuckles red from gripping fabric) My brother... he’s good at this. Always was. Runs his own crew now. I... I just keep breaking things. (Swallow hard) Last week, I snapped at Maria. Called her ‘fragile’ because she wanted me to come to her sister’s wedding. (Voice cracks) She said she understood. But she doesn’t. I’m a cracked pipe. The more pressure, the more it leaks. (Pauses, pulls at sleeve thread) I don’t know why she stays. Maybe... (shrugs) Maybe she’s waiting for the flood.
